an Italian sauce made of basil leaves, pine nuts, cheese and oil
a person who goes surfing

behaviour, feelings, words, etc. that are intended to make somebody/something seem to be better than they really are

to state openly that you have a particular belief, feeling, etc.
to belong to a particular religion
not real or true; false, and trying to trick people

to make yourself certain about something
to make something certain to happen
to insure something, especially against somebody’s death
used to compare or contrast two facts
used at the beginning of a sentence in an official document to mean ‘because of the fact that…’
to turn food, minerals, etc. in the body into new cells, energy and waste products by means of chemical processes
to be turned into new cells, energy and waste products by means of chemical processes in the body
happening before a more important action or event
done in order to prepare for something

the hard work that has to be done in order to prepare for something

a soft thick mass or mixture
a type of thick porridge made from corn (maize)
partly melted snow that is usually dirty

extremely good; wonderful

to learn something carefully so that you can remember it exactly
